availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis Hurst (Brooklyn (Kings Co), New York, attorney and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: Kings County, New York, attorney and commissioner of deeds. New York native. Married to Mary E. Hurst. Father of Lewis Hurst, Mary Hurst, Josephine Hurst, Arthur Hurst, and Werner Hurst. Attorney in Brooklyn, New York, in 1860. Member of the Board of Directors of the Kings County Fire Insurance Company in 1860. Commissioner of deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in New York in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, New York, Kings County, Brooklyn, Ward 11, District 2, p. 184.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, New York, Kings County, Brooklyn, Ward 20, p. 153B.
The Brooklyn Daily Eagle (Brooklyn, NewYork), February 22, 1860, p. 4.
